definition: good-looking/charming/(of goods) in great demand/(coll.) to season (food)

sentences.english: And wha met ye there, my handsome young man?
sentences.chinese: 你遇见了什么，我俊俏的年轻人？

sentences.english: And wha did she give you, my handsome young man?
sentences.chinese: 她给了你什么，我俊俏的年轻人？

sentences.english: But he became a bad boy because of his handsomeness .
sentences.chinese: 但是他却因为他的俊俏而变成一个坏小孩。

sentences.english: The dainty lass is his sister.
sentences.chinese: 那位俊俏的小姑娘是他妹妹。

sentences.english: It’s no surprise it’s considered to be the world’s most handsome pheasant.
sentences.chinese: 也难怪它被认为是世界上最俊俏的野鸡了。

sentences.english: She has a wonderfully beautiful face.
And what became of them, my handsome young man?
sentences.chinese: 它怎样了呢，我俊俏的年轻人？

sentences.english: More often than not, Leo men are handsome and irresistibly sexy.
sentences.chinese: 并且大多数狮子男都具有俊俏的外表和迷人的气质。

sentences.english: Having the best-looking boy and the best dancer is a mark of prestige.
sentences.chinese: 拥有最俊俏的男孩和最好的舞男是威望的象征。

sentences.english: And wha gat your leavins, my handsome young man?
sentences.chinese: 你的剩饭被如何处置，我俊俏的年轻人？

definition: to have bright eyes and white teeth
lit. countenance of a flower, face like the moon (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) beautiful
